Detailed Description

template<class DERIVED, int DIFFSCHEME = DifferenceScheme::Forward>
class LevMarSolver< DERIVED, DIFFSCHEME >

This is a wrapper for Eigen's Levenberg-Marquardt solver. Inherit from this class to add the levmar_solve() method to your class. The parent class should provide an

int operator()(const VectorXd &params, VectorXd &err)

method which calculates the error vector for a given set of parameters. The return value should be zero.

You may also optionally provide a

int df(const VectorXd &params, MatrixXd &jac)

method that calculates the Jacobian for a given set of parameters. If this is not present, then the Jacobian will be calculated by numerical differentiation, but this will result in more calls to operator().

DERIVED the type of the parent class DIFFSCHEME the finite difference scheme to use when df() is not present in the inheriting. Can be 'DifferenceSchemeForward' (default) or 'DifferenceSchemeCentral'

) [inline]

Call this from your inheriting class to solve with a given start state

Parameters:
params the state to start the solver in.
n the number of values in the error vector.

Eigen::Matrix< S, Eigen::Dynamic, Eigen::Dynamic > &  jac 
) [inline]

Implementation of a numerical differentiation calculation of the Jacobian. Called by the solver. Overload this in order to provide your own Jacobian calculation.

Parameters:
p the parameter values.
jac matrix to store the Jacobian in.
